question: 作用
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>make</kanji> a <kanji>task</kanji> you're looking for a certain <vocabulary>effect</vocabulary> and/or <vocabulary>action</vocabulary>. What task can you make right now to get the effect of learning more kanji?
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>作</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

What's the <vocabulary>effect</vocabulary> of a <reading>saw</reading> on <reading>yo</reading>ghurt (<ja>さよう</ja>)? What will the <vocabulary>action</vocabulary> of the saw on the yoghurt do? Seems futile, but you're going to try anyway. For science.
